task.title: Create a Data Rule and Alert
task.shortdesc: Now before we run the basic pipeline, let's add a data rule and alert. Data rules are user-defined rules used to inspect data moving between two stages. They are a powerful way to look for outliers and anomalous data.

context.p: Data rules and alerts require a detailed understanding of the data passing through the pipeline. For more general pipeline monitoring information, you can use metric rules and alerts.

The script in the Jython Evaluator creates error records for credit card transactions without credit card numbers. We can create a data rule and alert to let us know when the record count reaches a specified threshold.
We'll use an expression with the record:value() function to identify when the credit card number field, /credit_card, is null. The function returns the data in the specified field.

step.cmd: Between the Stream Selector and the Jython Evaluator, select the link or Data Inspection icon: .
step.info: The Data Rules tab displays in the Preview panel.

step.cmd: In the Data Rule dialog box, configure the following properties.

strow.stentry: At least 10 missing credit card numbers!

info.p: This creates an alert that goes off after finding ten records that don't include credit card numbers in the credit card payment stream.
info.note: With a larger data set, a smaller sampling percentage and higher threshold value might be appropriate, but we'll use these numbers for the purposes of the tutorial.

step.info: The rule displays in the data rule list. And the Data Inspection icon darkens to show that a data rule is configured for the stream.

step.cmd: To enable the data rule and alert, click Active.
step.info: Notice the Data Inspection icon becomes a darker grey to show that a data rule is active on the stream.
